summary: This document is a digital forensics timeline analysis report detailing computer activity from two Bureau of Prisons employees on August 9-10, 2019. It shows file access related to Special Housing Unit (SHU) procedures and other prison operations, including accessing a sentencing memorandum for Omar Amanat.

persons.name: Michael Thomas
persons.context: BOP employee (B0P19012) whose computer activity is being analyzed; accessed SHU-related documents and forms on August 10, 2019.

persons.name: Tova Noel
persons.context: BOP employee (BOP61232) whose computer activity is being analyzed; accessed VA benefits documents and a sentencing memorandum for Omar Amanat on August 9-10, 2019.

persons.name: Omar Amanat
persons.context: Individual whose sentencing memorandum was accessed by Tova Noel on August 10, 2019; mentioned in the filename of a PDF document.

events.title: Computer Activity Analysis - Michael Thomas
events.description: Digital forensics timeline shows Michael Thomas accessing multiple SHU-related documents including check sheets, rules, and forms from the Metropolitan Correctional Center New York.

events.title: Computer Activity Analysis - Tova Noel
events.description: Digital forensics timeline shows Tova Noel accessing VA benefits documents and opening a sentencing memorandum for Omar Amanat.

keyFacts: The document is a digital forensics analysis of computer activity from two BOP employees (Michael Thomas and Tova Noel) around August 9-10, 2019.
Michael Thomas accessed multiple Special Housing Unit (SHU) documents including check sheets, rules, and forms specific to the Metropolitan Correctional Center New York.
Tova Noel accessed a sentencing memorandum for Omar Amanat (case nysd-1_2015-cr-00536) on August 10, 2019.
The analysis indicates files were located in ZIP files and some required retrieval from BOP systems.
Activity includes accessing prison roster databases and daily security forms through BOP network systems.
